intro: Psychotria microthyrsa, commonly known as the small-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native range.
